title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 17 February 2012 - XWiki
content:
01:34 <rrodriguez> has quit  
02:01 <Enygma`> has quit  
02:26 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
02:35 <jvdrean> has quit  
02:43 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
02:49 <jvdrean> has quit  
05:31 <DrLou> has quit  
05:50 <CIA-120> cjdelisle master \* r5751b9d https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/5751b9dae37bd560aa3b4c8c102a576210bb5de0 / (2 files in 2 dirs): Merge branch 'XWIKI-7541' - http://git.io/fw48Zw  
05:59 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
06:00 <@sdumitriu> cjd: Don't forget to close the issue  
06:01 <@cjd> ahh indeed, thankyou  
06:01 <@cjd> XWIKI-7541  
06:01 <Denis> has quit  
06:02 <@sdumitriu> The bot doesn't do this anymore, no idea why  
06:02 <@cjd> hmm  
06:04 <@cjd> I have a working improved version of fs attachments in a branch but I can't merge it until we have a decent migrator since it stores things a bit differently.  
06:04 <@cjd> it stores empty deleted attachments in the database to appease the script  
06:04 <@cjd> s/merge/propose merging/  
06:05 <@sdumitriu> Ping Denis for his migration commits  
06:48 <cjd> has quit  
06:48 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
07:09 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
07:50 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:54 <rrodriguez> has quit  
08:11 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:19 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Could you update http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?mode=hide&requestId=11291 with the recent versions?  
08:40 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
08:41 <+Denis> sdumitriu: what feature are you waiting for ?  
08:41 <@sdumitriu> The new database migration  
08:41 <@sdumitriu> cjd is waiting as well  
08:42 <+Denis> liquibase ?  
08:44 <+Denis> ok, seems ci is now more stable, this what I was waiting for  
08:45 <+Denis> but, seems no one comment the local id issue we had with object  
08:58 <vmassol> sdumitriu: doing it  
08:59 <vmassol> sdumitriu: done  
09:18 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Thanks  
09:18 <@sdumitriu> A lot of issues done in 3.  
09:18 <@sdumitriu> x  
09:19 <vmassol> pity we cannot compare with 2.x  
09:21 <vmassol> today I'm finishing a git integration that allows us to have all stats from git directly inside wiki pages. It's really powerful and will be nice for the new home page and the new community page  
09:21 <@sdumitriu> Cool  
09:36 <sdumitriu> has quit  
09:40 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:53 <+Denis> vmassol: I broke clirr check in legacy-oldcore while passing those of oldcore, is that expected ?  
09:54 <+Denis> (for changes in oldcore, obviously)  
10:13 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:27 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:39 <evalica> has left #xwiki  
10:39 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:53 <vmassol> mflorea: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/Blog/XWiki%20Enterprise%2035%20Milestone%201%20Released is the link I get when I click on the tweet  
10:53 <vmassol> but it's broken  
10:54 <vmassol> if I remember correctly the same happened last time  
10:54 <vmassol> "#XWiki Enterprise 3.5 Milestone 1 has been #released! Check it out: http://purl.org/xwiki/rn/XE35M1"  
11:22 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
11:27 <+sburjan> hello everybody  
11:33 <+mflorea> vmassol: will you help me update Wikimatrix for 3.5M1 release?  
11:34 <vmassol> mflorea: doing it  
11:34 <+mflorea> thanks  
11:36 <sburjan> has quit  
11:37 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
12:05 <CIA-120> Denis Gervalle master \* re005bde https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/e005bdef5bf2807b56407bec377ea9849a41f5c0 / (3 files in 3 dirs): XWIKI-6990: Reduce the likelihood of having duplicate (hibernate) id for different documents and objects ...  
12:39 <mflorea> has quit  
12:59 <+sburjan> If I want t setup a jenkins agent, do I have to also build platform ?  
12:59 <+sburjan> the agent is for running UI-tests  
13:00 <@cjd> nope, you can do it without building platform, it will just download it  
13:02 <+sburjan> tryiog  
13:02 <+sburjan> trying  
13:03 <+sburjan> I see the jenkins agents we have ... show a slightly different config menu, even if mine is the same version, I guess this is because of the installed plugins.. gonna check tose too  
13:05 <DrLou\_> has joined #xwiki  
13:08 <vmassol> first time I see webstandards blocked: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-manager-test-webstandards/616/console  
13:08 <vmassol> killin git  
13:13 <+sburjan> ok, not good. jenkins keeps downloading a 3.2-SNAPSHOT  
13:13 <+sburjan> I have to force it to use the master/trunk  
13:30 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:47 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
13:53 <+sburjan> ok, I managed to run ui-tests on chrome within Jenkins :)  
13:54 <+sburjan> I am gonna leave it running to see which tests fail on Linux + Chrome  
14:11 <vmassol> ok I'm very excited about http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Git+Module ;)  
14:26 <+sburjan> ok, so we have : Tests run: 158, Failures: 0, Errors: 77, Skipped: 0  
14:26 <+sburjan> on Linux + Chrome  
14:58 <vmassol> I've now executed the script on all repos defined on GitHub for the xwiki org  
14:58 <vmassol> result: http://pastebin.com/h30jp0Ba  
14:58 <vmassol> so 4855 in one year  
15:00 <+sburjan> I have a question: If a \_ton\_ of tests fail on Chrome because a modal appears and all tests after that fail, should I create a issue on Platform to fix the test ? Issue is that it only happens on Chrome.. when editing a 1.0 Syntax page I get a modal that it is not supported, and all other tests after this will fail  
15:02 <+sburjan> this would mean introducing custom code in the test.. like if browser == chrome, click on the modal to make it go away  
15:02 <+sburjan> or the best approach would be to create a pull request to exclude the test on Chrome FTM  
15:02 <+sburjan> wstyt ?  
15:03 <+sburjan> \*wdyt ?  
15:07 <vmassol> ok better result: http://pastebin.com/xD3t3fEd  
15:24 <+sburjan> vmassol: will we build platform too on the windows agents ?  
15:25 <vmassol> sburjan: not right now since it doesn't build on it ATM  
15:26 <+sburjan> because of the long paths, right ?  
15:26 <vmassol> yep  
15:26 <+sburjan> ok, thanks  
15:26 <+sburjan> so we're on the right track ...  
15:29 <vmassol> committer activity for 1 year on all xwiki organization projects, sorted by activity: https://skitch.com/e-vmassol/8nxub/github-main.github-xwiki  
15:30 <+sburjan> hmm... I see yourself listed twice. Also, I have done more than 2 pull requests on platform + enterprise. Are you sure the data is accurate ?  
15:30 <vmassol> sburjan: 2 things  
15:31 <vmassol> 1) I need to find a way to aggregate data when the users are the same person but committed with different user names  
15:31 <vmassol> 2) This is commiters only, not authors (which I can also do but I was interested in committers here)  
15:32 <vmassol> 3) I need to understand why there are some non committers isted!  
15:32 <+sburjan> ok, so I guess my 2 commits are from contrib - jira macro  
15:32 <vmassol> (like ebeutler)  
15:32 <vmassol> contrib is not there  
15:32 <vmassol> this is the xwiki org  
15:32 <vmassol> not the xwiki-contrib org  
15:33 <+sburjan> ok, then something is odd, because I am not a committer ;)  
15:33 <vmassol> :)  
15:37 <vmassol> sburjan: this one for example: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/abd9bd307a9c84508b6d6ec446f87bf977df2069  
15:38 <vmassol> or https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/bc329f3e6858cd53c309a87007f506fab28c1bc1  
15:38 <vmassol> was this a pull request?  
15:39 <vmassol> can't find a way for github to tell me that  
15:39 <+sburjan> I'm almost sure it was, because I don't have commit rights on Enterprise nor Platform  
15:40 <+sburjan> it is odd that it doesn't appear as a pull request  
15:43 <vmassol> indeed it says you're both the author and committer  
15:44 <+sburjan> well I can't imagine how could I be the committer .. since .. I am not a committer  
15:45 <+sburjan> I'm not even listed among the 17 committers, so I can't be a committer  
15:49 <+sburjan> how much RAM memory do we have allocated for our Jenkins Agents ?  
15:54 <rsjafe> has joined #xwiki  
15:55 <rsjafe> hi there, I'm having trouble getting the Meeting Manager Application to function properly. When I want to add participants to a meeting I get a message saying no results! And the tags don't work. I'm using meeting manager 1.2 and XWiki enterprise 3.4  
15:55 <rsjafe> Server: tomcat and OS Windows XP 32bit  
15:56 <rsjafe> can anyone help?  
15:57 <vmassol> sburjan: sergiu told me that pull requests will make you the committer  
15:59 <+sburjan> odd, because usually commits from pull requests appear differently in the github UI  
16:00 <+sburjan> you can easily spot a pull request because the committer is a committer (with the message .. merged from xwiki/author repo), and below is the author  
16:07 <rsjafe> anyone knows how to solve the problems of the MeetingManager Application?  
16:14 <vmassol> rsjafe: sorry I haven't used it  
16:14 <vmassol> its author is jerome velociter…. :) he would be hte one who could help you on this  
16:17 <rsjafe> vmassol: Ok, thanks I'll check back later. Does he usually comes to this IRC channel?  
16:18 <vmassol> from time to time but not very often  
16:18 <vmassol> you could ask on the list  
16:25 <rsjafe> ok, I've joined the list, I'll send a mair over there, thanks  
16:37 <vmassol> ok here are the massaged results: https://skitch.com/e-vmassol/8ntre/github-main.github-xwiki  
16:54 <djdirks> has joined #xwiki  
17:36 <sburjan> has quit  
17:47 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
17:54 <evalica> has quit  
18:04 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
18:15 <mflorea> has quit  
18:31 <rsjafe> has quit  
19:11 <jvdrean> has quit  
19:19 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
20:07 <lucaa> has quit  
21:50 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
22:02 <vmassol> quick question, how do I set an xobject static list prop? I tried myObj.set("prop", ArrayList) and myObj.set("prop", "val1|val2") and both failed  
22:03 <@sdumitriu> The second one should work  
22:03 <@sdumitriu> Wait  
22:03 <@sdumitriu> Is that in Java or Velocity?  
22:03 <vmassol> according to the source I read both should work  
22:03 <vmassol> velcoity  
22:04 <@sdumitriu> Indeed, both should work  
22:04 <@sdumitriu> How does it fail?  
22:04 <vmassol> hmm in the class declaration do I need to check realtional storage? (not sure what this odes)  
22:05 <vmassol> when I pass the ArrayList I get:  
22:05 <vmassol> Caused by: java.lang.ClassCastException: java.util.ArrayList cannot be cast to java.lang.String  
22:05 <vmassol> at com.xpn.xwiki.objects.BaseStringProperty.setValue(BaseStringProperty.java:53)  
22:06 <vmassol> I use it like this:  
22:06 <vmassol>       committerDoc.set("repositories", projects)  
22:13 <@sdumitriu> I think you should check both multiselect and relstorage  
22:14 <vmassol> yep indeed I just tried it and it works now  
22:14 <vmassol> that's strange though that it's considered a stirng otherwise  
22:14 <vmassol> anyway, got my answer thanks  
22:14 <vmassol> (would need to check the code to better understand those params one day)  
22:14 <@sdumitriu> com.xpn.xwiki.objects.classes.ListClass.newProperty()  
22:15 <@sdumitriu> Apparently it should work only with MultiSelect  
22:22 <CIA-120> Denis Gervalle master \* rfff5969 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/fff596946f22e79cda9b3169e9d2d4d2b9ba3a9a / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/store/migration/AbstractDataMigrationManager.java : XWIKI-6990: Reduce the likelihood of having duplicate (hibernate) id for different documents and objects ...  
22:30 <pgmjsd> has quit  
23:17 <vmassol> has quit  
23:20 <abusenius> has quit
